sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"刺入，穿透"之意。
means: pierce ： 多指人为地用刀刺、剑等尖锐东西刺穿或刺入某物。
penetrate ： 较正式用词，可指用任何工具穿入或穿透，也可指光线、声音等透过物体。
prick ： 一般指用针等刺穿。
stab ： 主要指利器刺入、刺伤，如用匕首、短刀等。
thrust ： 本义是使某物进入或把某物刺进或使之穿透某物，有时侧重穿透、刺入。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"推，推动"之意。
means: propel ： 侧重指靠外力把人或物稳定、持续地向前推进。
push ： 普通用词，指用突然的力量把人或物
推向前进、推开或推到另一位置上。
shove ： 一般指猛或费力地推开或移动人或物。
thrust ： 常指迅猛地一推或突然有力地推进，侧重速度。

word_mean: 推力径向轴承, thrust-journal bearing
推力, 发动机所产生的推动飞行器运动的力，是气流作用在发动机内、外表面上各种力的合力。

sentence.Network_en: He reached the garden gate and thrust his way through it.
sentence.Network_cn: 他来到花园门口，挤了进去。

sentence.Network_en: Tony has now been thrust into the limelight, with a high-profile job.
sentence.Network_cn: 托尼现在一下子成了众人关注的中心，因为他有一份经常出镜、见报的工作。

sentence.Network_en: The conductor brought home the full thrust of the work's emotional resolution.
sentence.Network_cn: 指挥将该作品情感上的毅然决然这一主旨充分表现了出来。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): from Old Norse thrýsta; perhaps related to Latin trudere 'to thrust'. The noun is first recorded (early 16th cent.) in the sense 'act of pressing'

entry.def: If you thrust something or someone somewhere, you push or move them there quickly with a lot of force.

example.ex: They thrust him into the back of a jeep...
example.tran: 他们把他硬塞进吉普车后座。

example.ex: She grabs a stack of baby photos and thrusts them into my hands.
example.tran: 她抓起一沓婴儿照片塞到我手里。

entry.def: If you thrust your way somewhere, you move there, pushing between people or things which are in your way.

example.ex: She thrust her way into the crowd...
He reached the garden gate and thrust his way through it.
example.tran: 他来到花园门口，挤了进去。

entry.def: If something thrusts up or out of something else, it sticks up or sticks out in a noticeable way.

example.ex: An aerial thrust up from the grass verge...
example.tran: 一根天线在草地边上竖立着。

example.ex: A ray of sunlight thrust out through the clouds.
example.tran: 一缕阳光透过云层照射下来。

entry.tran: (车辆等的)推力，反压力，侧向压力
entry.def: Thrust is the power or force that is required to make a vehicle move in a particular direction.

example.ex: It provides the thrust that makes the craft move forward.
example.tran: 它提供了飞机前进所需的推力。

entry.tran: (活动、思想的)要点，主要内容，要旨
entry.def: The thrust of an activity or of an idea is the main or essential things it expresses.

example.ex: The real thrust of the film is its examination of New York's Hasidic community...
example.tran: 这部电影的真正要旨是它审视了纽约的哈西德教徒。

example.ex: The main thrust of the research will be the study of the early Universe and galaxy formation...
example.tran: 此项研究的核心是早期宇宙和银河系的形成。

sentences.sentence: "the push of the water on the walls of the tank"

means.word_mean: 2. a thrusting blow with a knife or other sharp pointed instrument;

sentences.sentence: "one strong stab to the heart killed him"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of applying force to propel something;

sentences.sentence: "after reaching the desired velocity the drive is cut off"
"he enlivened his editorials with barbed thrusts at politicians"

means.word_mean: 5. a sharp hand gesture (resembling a blow);

sentences.sentence: "he warned me with a jab with his finger"
"he made a thrusting motion with his fist"
"She thrust the letter into his hand"

means.word_mean: 4. impose or thrust urgently, importunately, or inexorably;

sentences.sentence: "She forced her diet fads on him"

means.word_mean: 5. penetrate or cut through with a sharp instrument
6. geology: thrust (molten rock) into pre-existing rock

sentences.sentence: "The front of the trains that had collided head-on thrust up into the air"

means.word_mean: 8. place or put with great energy;

sentences.sentence: "She threw the blanket around the child"
"thrust the money in the hands of the beggar"

sentences.en: The tree thrusts its branches high.
sentences.cn: 这棵树的枝条伸得高高的。

jushi.english: The tree thrusts its branches high.
jushi.chinese: 这棵树的枝条伸得高高的。

jushi.english: The tree thrusts its roots far and wide.
jushi.chinese: 这棵树的根向四周延伸。
